title: Modernizing the Gmail's – People Card
subtitle: Google Workspace | People Card – Design System | Shipped 2024
intro: Redesigned People Hover card used by millions to align with modern guidelines. Improved information access, personalization, and scalability across consumer and enterprise contexts.

facts.My Role: UX/Visual Designer — strategy, future enhancements, personalization, and partner engagement
facts.Skills: Visual Design, Stakeholder Management, Interactive Prototyping
facts.Impact: Increased engagement, faster comprehension, scalable foundations

sections.label: Overview
sections.heading: Project overview
paragraphs: Redesigned People Hover card to align with new guidelines, improving information access for both enterprise and consumer users while modernizing UX and expanding functionality.
This product spans complex data and workflows. A system-driven approach ensured consistency across surfaces while creating a foundation for continued development.

sections.label: Introduction
sections.heading: Introduction
paragraphs: The People Card is a frequent entry point for details and actions. Our objective was to harmonize clarity, density, and extensibility.
We audited current usage, mapped jobs-to-be-done, and prioritized experience principles.

sections.label: Problems & Project Goals
sections.heading: Problems & project goals
paragraphs: Legacy information hierarchy made scanning difficult. Actions lacked predictability across contexts.
Goals: improve glanceability, unify action patterns, and support future modules without breaking mental models.

sections.label: Opportunity
sections.heading: Opportunity
paragraphs: Introduce scalable patterns that span consumer and enterprise needs while minimizing rework across product lines.

sections.label: Final designs
sections.heading: Final designs
paragraphs: Refined layout, strong typographic rhythm, consistent iconography, and contextual actions. Patterns validated via prototype studies.

sections.label: Outcomes & Impact
sections.heading: Outcomes & impact
paragraphs: Increased engagement and task completion rate. Reduced time to action. Established a scalable design system baseline.

sections.label: Takeaways
sections.heading: Takeaways
paragraphs: Balance density and clarity with composable patterns. System thinking accelerates iteration and downstream adoption.
